snippet: A lawsuit against the Department of Veterans Affairs charges that veterans with PTSD from sexual assaults have more difficulty proving their illness to the department — and thus obtaining disability benefits.
abstract: Two veterans groups and a Yale legal clinic sue Department of Veterans Affairs, charging that veterans with post-traumatic stress disorder from sexual assaults during their service have more difficulty proving their illness to the department and thus obtaining disability benefits than veterans with other forms of PTSD.
lead_paragraph: A lawsuit against the Department of Veterans Affairs charges that veterans with PTSD from sexual assaults have more difficulty proving their illness to the department — and thus obtaining disability benefits.

headline.main: Veterans Agency Is Sued Over Handling of Trauma Cases
headline.print_headline: Veterans Agency Sued Over Handling of Trauma Cases
